description.value: This crude armor consists of thick furs and pelts.

Melee or Ranged Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Dwarven Resilience. The dwarf has advantage on saving throws against &Reference[poison]{poison}.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Innate Spellcasting. The dwarf’s innate spellcasting ability is &Reference[wis]{Wisdom}. It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components:

1/day each: hunter's mark, jump, pass without trace, speak with animals, speak with plants

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

You choose a creature you can see within range and mystically mark it as your quarry. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 damage to the target whenever you hit it with a weapon attack, and you have advantage on any &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) or &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[sur]{Survival}) check you make to find it. If the target drops to 0 hit points before this spell ends, you can use a bonus action on a subsequent turn of yours to mark a new creature.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd or 4th level, you can maintain your &Reference[concentration]{concentration} on the spell for up to 8 hours. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can maintain your &Reference[concentration]{concentration} on the spell for up to 24 hours.

system.chatFlavor: [1d6 - bludgeoning] Weapon Damage Type - bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing, [1d6 - piercing] Weapon Damage Type - bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing, [1d6 - slashing] Weapon Damage Type - bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing

description.value: You touch a creature. The creature's jump distance is tripled until the spell ends.

A veil of shadows and silence radiates from you, masking you and your companions from detection. For the duration, each creature you choose within 30 feet of you (including you) has a +10 bonus to &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} (&Reference[ste]{Stealth}) checks and can't be tracked except by magical means. A creature that receives this bonus leaves behind no tracks or other traces of its passage.

You gain the ability to comprehend and verbally communicate with beasts for the duration. The knowledge and awareness of many beasts is limited by their &Reference[int]{intelligence}, but at minimum, beasts can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever they can perceive or have perceived within the past day. You might be able to persuade a &Reference[beast]{beast} to perform a small favor for you, at the GM's discretion.

You imbue plants within 30 feet of you with limited sentience and animation, giving them the ability to communicate with you and follow your simple commands. You can question plants about events in the spell’s area within the past day, gaining information about creatures that have passed, weather, and other circumstances.

You can also turn difficult terrain caused by &Reference[plant]{plant} growth (such as thickets and undergrowth) into ordinary terrain that lasts for the duration. Or you can turn ordinary terrain where plants are present into difficult terrain that lasts for the duration, causing vines and branches to hinder pursuers, for example.

Plants might be able to perform other tasks on your behalf, at the GM’s discretion. The spell doesn’t enable plants to uproot themselves and move about, but they can freely move branches, tendrils, and stalks.

If a &Reference[plant]{plant} creature is in the area, you can communicate with it as if you shared a common language, but you gain no magical ability to influence it.

This spell can cause the plants created by the entangle spell to release a &Reference[restrained]{restrained} creature.
